channel.title: Auto-updating[?]
channel.description:
Can anyone explain to me how to create an auto-updater? For now I just want to learn how to make it eliminate the traps.
Thank you.

item.title: Auto-updating[?]
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Well basically you need a renamer.

This searches and replaces varibles by patterns and renames them. ( :o shock! )

So if you have this code for example err ill nick one of vortex's methods coz im feeling lazy

public void method467(int uid)
{
int anInt457 = uid;
int anInt567 = anInt457 & 0x7f;
int anInt777 = anInt457 >> 7 & 0x7f;
	Method457(683, anInt457, anInt567, anInt777);
}

Well we all know in the next update that shits gonna change. So we rename it like so by looking for patterns.

public void atObject2(int uid)
{
int id = uid;
int x = id & 0x7f;
int y = id >> 7 & 0x7f;
	action(683, id, x, y);
}

If the patterns havnt changed it should rename.

You can then make a bot.java or watever to use the functions. The bot.java should only really have to be updated every so often like if any parameters change etc.

so anyways you can use the method. Import it from client.java and use it in a script engine yay!

client.Object2

So everytime rs updates you run the rename , rename it all and hey presto you got yourself an updated bot

Its not as simple as that!!!

Im just giving you the kinda idea/concept of it

Read full topic
